text:
I have my WSUS test environment set to auto-sync and auto-approve patches at
1:10 pm EST so it gets the patches as soon as Microsoft releases them
on Patch Tuesday (usually at 10 am PST) but yesterday I got nothing at that
time. 
When I manually sync’d this morning it was unusually small bringing in only 43
updates for a total of 11.1 GB.
Usually it is much higher than that with patch metadata and anywhere from 15 to
21 GB of binary data. 
Is everyone else seeing the same thing and any speculation why the release was
later than usual and the size was so small this time? 
Justin Blocksom | Senior System Administrator | WSUS Enterprise Architect

Universal Health Services, Inc.| UHS of Delaware, Inc.| 367 South Gulph Road,
King of Prussia, PA 19406 | www.uhsinc.com
 
UHS of Delaware, Inc. Confidentiality Notice: This e-mail message, including any
attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain
confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use,
disclosure or distribution of this information is prohibited, and may be
punishable by law. If this was sent to you in error, please notify the sender by
reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message. 
--
%40IA0PR15MB5548.namprd15.prod.outlook.com
